item.title: Presentations
item.author: gdrnbody@lct.jussieu.fr
item.description: Keynote speakers David Gontier (CEREMADE, Paris) DFT for two-dimensional homogeneous slabs In this talk, we study DFT models for homogeneous 2-d slabs in the 3-d space, and derive reduced equations in the direction orthogonal to the slab. We show in particular that the Pauli principle is replaced by a penalization term in the energy. We show how to solve these new equations, and we provide some properties for the minimizer, such as the decay of the density away from the slab.
